image.altText: Keir Starmer and Volodymyr Zelenskyy embrace outside 10 Downing street as Zelenskyy waves to camera

props.synopsis: European leaders have expressed "horror" at the extraordinary scenes in the Oval Office, as the Ukrainian president urges the United States to be "more firmly on our side".

title.children: After clashing with Trump, Zelenskyy says 'tough dialogue' needed

image.altText: Anthony Albanese, wearing a black suit and a pastel green tie, speaks in front of a Medicare backdrop

props.synopsis: The prime minister's Overton window is the size of a porthole but the paradox of Albanese's policy conservatism is that he's left Peter Dutton with very little to unwind should the Coalition win.

title.children: Albanese might be wary of voter backlash but there's a high cost to doing nothing

image.altText: An elderly man in white clothing and a skull cap gestures as he speaks into a silver microphone.

props.synopsis: In an update on Saturday, the Vatican says the 88-year-old pope didn't have any further respiratory crises overnight, following a coughing fit on Friday during which he inhaled vomit.

title.children: Pope Francis drinking coffee, resting after breathing incident, Vatican says

image.altText: Zelenskyy and Trump shouting at each other

props.synopsis: It was supposed to be a major step towards peace. Instead, the world watched on as relations disintegrated in less than an hour, leaving Ukraine's future hanging in the balance, writes Carrington Clarke.

title.children: Trump and Zelenskyy's meeting was going fine. Then JD Vance interjected

image.altText: A woman sits at a desk and looks into the camera. Her reflection can be seen on a computer screen.

props.synopsis: The ABC looked at how home insurance premiums compared for different age groups around the country — the results were surprising.

title.children: Should younger people pay more for home insurance? Experts are divided

image.altText: The outside of a commercial building with Medicare Urgent Care Clinic signage

props.synopsis: Labor is promising to expand the existing 87-clinic network if re-elected, with this $644 million promise coming on top of the $8.5 billion pledged last weekend to lift bulk-billing rates.

title.children: Labor commits to opening 50 new urgent care clinics

image.altText: Hamas militants with faces covered pointing guns in air.

props.synopsis: Hamas says it has rejected an Israeli proposal to extend phase one of the ceasefire deal in Gaza, throwing the Middle East peace process into uncertainty just hours before the first stage of the agreement is set to expire.

title.children: Israel-Hamas ceasefire in peril as first phase set to expire

image.altText: Our AI future

props.synopsis: The future rarely unfolds like we expect. Although Hollywood has given us plenty of technological tropes to worry about, our AI future is much more mundane and much more insidious.

title.children: Working in AI, people ask me if I'm pessimistic. This is what keeps me up at night

image.altText: A digital illustraion of a man from nose down holding a hairdressing magazine with Vietnamese rice farmers in backgroud.

props.synopsis: The promise of work led Duong to Thailand, but he was soon enslaved in a remote corner of war-torn Myanmar, forced to carry out online cryptocurrency "pig-butchering" scams. It is part of a growing global problem affecting thousands of Australians every year.

title.children: Have you fallen prey to an online scam? Your scammer might also be a victim

image.altText: A wave crashes over a beach walkway.

props.synopsis: Authorities tell central and southern Queenslanders to stay off the water this weekend as the severe tropical cyclone flexes its muscle offshore.

title.children: Warnings as Alfred pummels coast with strong winds, dangerous surf

image.altText: Gene Hackman at the Golden Globes in 2003, smiling on the red carpet

props.synopsis: Gene Hackman and Betsy Arakawa's initial autopsies finds the pair suffered no external trauma and tested negative for carbon monoxide poisoning.

title.children: Hackman's pacemaker stopped nine days before discovery, sheriff says

image.altText: A Skype logo next to a Messenger logo on a phone screen

props.synopsis: The Microsoft-owned service was a pioneer in live video calls but later lost ground to competing programs such as Zoom.

title.children: Microsoft to shut down Skype in May after more than two decades

image.altText: A close-up of a Buddhist stone statue with closed eyes and a neutral, peaceful expression on its face.

props.synopsis: Statues and hundreds of culturally significant artefacts have been returned to Indonesia by the Dutch, but with close to 30 museum theft cases in recent decades authorities move to ensure these don't end up in an illegal private collection.

title.children: Indonesia got some treasures back, but can it protect them?

image.altText: Libby Mettam and Thomas Brough walk side-by-side while smiling outside the health campus

props.synopsis: WA Liberal leader Libby Mettam has ruled out a review of abortion laws while distancing herself from comments made by Albany candidate Thomas Brough, who has also linked the LGBTQIA+ community with paedophiles.

title.children: WA Liberals face more candidate controversy amid call to review abortion laws

image.altText: Beaumont children photo

props.synopsis: A seven-day search for the Beaumont children, who went missing from Glenelg Beach in 1966, has concluded after "almost 10,000 tonnes" of soil was dug up as part of the "biggest clandestine grave dig in the world".

title.children: 'We can walk away satisfied': Search for Beaumont children concludes

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Silver man at Mardi Gras 010325

props.synopsis: Thousands of people line Oxford Street, Flinders Parade and Anzac Parade in Darlinghurst for Sydney's 'free to be' Mardi Gras.

title.children: Oxford Street abuzz for Mardi Gras with disco balls and glitter but no Kylie

image.altText: Marty Sheargold wearing headphones and speaking on air for Triple M.

props.synopsis: The crude comments didn't surprise me, but what did disappoint me was how Sheargold's colleagues were such happy accomplices — chuckling along with easy laughs.

title.children: The wise words I passed onto my son after Marty Sheargold was taken off air

image.altText: A woman bends over a table with rubber gloves testing a substance.

props.synopsis: Wollongong's Yours and Owls Festival is hosting New South Wales' first pill testing trial and the first in Australia to be led by a government.

title.children: Inside Australia's first government-led pill testing trial

image.altText: Ajla Tomljanovic pumps her right fist during an Australian Open match.

props.synopsis: Australia's Ajla Tomljanović and Daria Saville advance to the last four of their respective WTA Tour events.

title.children: Tomljanović through to Austin semis as Saville triumphs in Mexico

image.altText: A close up of a young Thai man looking pensive with foliage in the background.

props.synopsis: Bannawat Saethao's daughter was just one month old when he was kidnapped by Hamas. For the first time, he shares the story of his terrifying capture — and the emotional moment he reunited with his family in Thailand.

title.children: Shot and held by Hamas for 480 days, a Thai hostage breaks his silence

image.altText: Two glasses of beer on a bench.

props.synopsis: The government will pause the biannual indexation of the draught beer excise for two years, a modest change that has been welcomed by the hotel industry.

title.children: Labor freezes indexation on draught beer excise

image.altText: Actor Gene Hackman with wife Betsy Arakawa

props.synopsis: Authorities have started to untangle what led to the discovery of Hollywood great Gene Hackman and wife Betsy Arakawa's bodies in their Santa Fe home.

title.children: Actor Gene Hackman's home was full of life. Then it fell silent

image.altText: Jillaroos players stand for the national anthem ahead of a Test against New Zealand.

props.synopsis: The Jillaroos will be at the centre of rugby league's Las Vegas extravaganza, where they have a chance to continue the growth of the women's game.

title.children: Women's rugby league features in Las Vegas, with drought-breaking Test

image.altText: A tracking bracelet on a man's ankle.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government is preparing to trial electronic monitoring devices on teenage criminals who are on bail in an attempt to re-engage them with school.

title.children: Victoria to trial ankle bracelets for high-risk high school offenders

image.altText: Australian Dollar coins and notes generic

props.synopsis: The Australian dollar sell-off suggests that while we may be slowly digging our way out of the cost-of-living crisis, global economic storm clouds are gathering.

title.children: The latest Australian dollar sell-off is a red flag for the economy

image.altText: A police car in the foreground, with red tape across the front of a house's yard and a police officer standing on a ladder

props.synopsis: A 33-year-old man has been killed in an alleged domestic violence incident in Darwin. A woman, believed to be the man's partner, has been arrested at the scene.

title.children: Darwin man killed in alleged domestic violence incident

image.altText: A kelpie collie dog, with brown fur in two shades and white patches sitting on couch next to blurred owner in background.

props.synopsis: Two-thirds of Australian households have a pet, but in some states body corporates can ban even home owners from keeping animals. With high-density housing on the rise, strata industry leaders and pet owners are advocating for change.

title.children: In four Australian jurisdictions, body corporates are allowed to ban pets

image.altText: An aerial photo of a tin shed with the walls unfolded outwards.

props.synopsis: While major centres "dodged a bullet", Cyclone Zelia's passage has devastated a string of remote communities and stations across the Pilbara.

title.children: Full extent of cyclone damage hits home for remote WA residents

image.altText: Aerial shot of the riverside Queens Wharf development

props.synopsis: Ensuring Brisbane's casino doesn't become an "eyesore without tenancies" should be a priority as further doubt is cast over the future of Star Entertainment, a business expert says.

title.children: Brisbane casino at risk of becoming an 'eyesore' as Star flounders

image.altText: Khaled Sabsabi, with dark hair pulled back and grey beard, stands against brown brick wall wearing dark shirt.

props.synopsis: The decision about Australia's Venice Biennale exhibition is political but it reveals a cycle in which flaws are found in institutions that should be at arm’s length from politics and leaves them too weak to do the job they were established for.

title.children: Art controversy reveals a trend that ultimately weakens institutions

image.altText: A two-storey guard tower sits behind rows of barbed-wire fences running along the border between North Korea and South Korea.

props.synopsis: Sounding somewhere between a wailing ghost or howling wolves, strange and disconcerting noises drift over the border from North Korea into South Korea — sometimes all day.

title.children: On the Korean peninsula, eerie noises are driving people wild

image.altText: Deputy NSW Ombudsman Steve Kinmond

props.synopsis: The state's Children Guardian Steve Kinmond has agreed to step aside from his role following complaints over a recent baby shower that included sperm-themed games.

title.children: NSW Children's Guardian to step aside amid 'urgent' inquiry into 'serious and disturbing' allegations

image.altText: A view from above of a man sitting cross-legged on a prayer mat with a quran in front of him and his hands open.

props.synopsis: Ramadan is a sacred time for Muslims around the world. Here's how non-Muslims can learn more and share the celebration.

title.children: Ramadan has begun. Here's what non-Muslims should know about the holy month
